intro: Sphaeralcea margaritae, commonly known as the silverleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features. Sphaeralcea margaritae is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
